citations.title: Abadi et al. Deep Learning with Differential Privacy
Bonawitz et al. Practical Secure Aggregation for Federated Learning on User-Held Data
llama.cpp (local, on-device LLM inference for GGUF models)
Rashkin et al. Towards Empathetic Open-domain Conversation Models (EmpatheticDialogues)
WHO guidance on AI ethics and governance for health
NIST AI Risk Management Framework (AI RMF 1.0)
Scoping and evaluations of mental health chatbots (review examples)
CLPsych shared task (self-harm risk patterns; for inspiration only)

The response synthesizes all cited evidence accurately with clear attribution, directly linking each technical component (e.g., llama.cpp for on-device inference [3], Presidio for PII redaction [7], NeMo Guardrails for safety [8], DP-SGD [1] and secure aggregation [2] for privacy, WHO [5] and NIST [6] for governance) to the experimental design, constraints, and checkpoints. It maintains consistency with the sources, such as using EmpatheticDialogues [4] for utility evaluation and CLPsych [13] for safety prompts, without contradictions or fabrications.
